table.name: mem
table.column: This can also be used for an "account" that someone can sign up for to use a service.[3]
Это также может использоваться для обозначения "аккаунта", который регистрируется для пользования какой-то услугой.[3]

This is defined only as "treaty" in {TKD:src}. The additional definitions come from {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2016:src}.
Possibly a reference to the fairy Queen Mab in Romeo and Juliet, who is known for making bargains with mortals.

table.name: mem
table.column: быть маленьким, быть небольшим, быть малым, быть мелким
A "match" is small, and is kept in a "match tin".

table.name: mem
table.column:
See the note under {mugh:v}.
Some word lists erroneously give another definition of {magh:v:nolink} with the meaning "indicate, reveal". This came from an old website called "Star Trek: Continuum", which had a "Klingon Linguistics Studies" section where someone (not Marc Okrand) took the official definitions and "expanded" them. This person apparently did not understand which meaning of the English word "betray" the Klingon word {magh:v:nolink} corresponded to.
René Magritte painted "La Trahison des images".

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a person who betrays someone. For a person who commits treason, see {'urwI':n}.
Речь идёт о человеке, который предаёт кого-то. Для лица, которое совершает измену смотрите {'urwI':n}.
René Magritte painted "La Trahison des images".

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a Klingon plant that most closely resembles grass.
In British English slang, to "grass on" someone means to betray them to a person in authority, such as police. (See {magh:v}.)

table.name: mem
mem
table.column: Note that this is a number-forming element, and not itself a number. The number ten is {wa'maH:n:num}, literally "one ten", in Klingon.
Заметьте, что это числообразующий элемент, а не число само по себе. Число десять будет -{wa'maH:n:num}. Дословно переводится, как "один десять".

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a large bowl, used for serving {chatlh:n:1}, which diners pour into a {Duq:n} to eat.[1, p.99]
Это большая миска, используемая для подачи {chatlh:n:1}, который обедающий вливает в {Duq:n} чтобы есть.[1, стр.99]

table.name: mem
table.column: This term has not been used in canon, but its meaning is inferred by analogy with {vatlh DIS poH:n}, etc. This entry is here for ease of reference only.

table.name: mem
table.column:
This is an exclamation expressing satisfaction. For the verb (or adjective) meaning "to be good", see {QaQ:v}.
This word does not have the sense of "good" as used in a greeting, such as "good morning" or "good night". While there is an idiomatic expression in Klingon, {maj ram:sen:nolink}, which is used in a similar manner to "good night", it actually means something like "Good, (it is) night".[2]

Это выражение удовлетворения. Для глагола (или прилагательного) означающего "быть хорошим", смотрите {QaQ:v}.
Это слово не имеет смысл "добрый"(или "хороший") который используется в поздравлении или пожелании, такой как "доброе утро" или "доброй ночи". Есть идиоматическое выражение в Клингонском языке, {maj ram:sen:nolink}, которое используется на манер "доброй ночи". Дословно это значит что-то типа "Хорошо!!!Сейчас ночь".[2]

In {TNK:src}, "Good morning" is given as {maj po:excl:nolink}, "Good afternoon" as {maj pov:excl:nolink}, and "Good evening" as {maj choS:excl:nolink}. In {DS9 - The Sword of Kahless:src}, Jadzia Dax and Kor said {maj ram:excl:nolink} to each other as she headed for bed.

table.name: mem
table.column: The first element of this word appears to be {maj:excl}. The second element may be related to {Qap:v:1}.

table.name: mem
table.column: Mahjong (麻將) is a Chinese game played with tiles.

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a person who lays tiles, as when constructing a floor.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is usually {malja' permey:n:nolink} in canon.
▶ Paramount Pictures {malja' permey bIH:sen:nolink} Star Trek {pong'e' Deghmey'e' je.:sen:nolink}[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: soldat (en krigare i en grupp om flera)
The word {mangpu':n@@mang:n, -pu':n} is seldom-used, and carries the notion that there are individuals making up the group. {negh:n} focuses on the group as a unit.[2]
Слово {mangpu':n@@mang:n, -pu':n} редко используется, и несет смысловую нагрузку, что есть люди, которые создают группу. Слово {negh:n} фокусируется на группе, как на подразделении.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to all of the {negh:n} together.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is not used as a title.

table.name: mem
table.column:
{SkyBox 31:src} has the line {ghoS tlhIngan SuvwI' maq:sen:nolink}, where {maq:v:nolink} is used without {'e':n:pro}, but it is not known whether this is a typo or a feature of how {maq:v:nolink} is used.
This was used to translate "print" or "output" (i.e., display something to the user, such as the value of a variable) for Klingon Blockly.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: buddy, pal, close male friend of a male
Kumpel, Freund (enger männlicher Freund eines Mannes)
دوست پسر، دوست نزدیک مرد دوست مرد [AUTOTRANSLATED]
polare, nära manlig vän till en man
дружок, дружбан, приятель, близкий друг мужского пола лица мужского пола

This word is used by one male in addressing another male who is a close friend. Use of this word in other contexts may be considered insulting or offensive. The word may derive from {may' qoch:n@@may':n, qoch:n}. It is not uncommon for a Klingon father to address his son as {maqoch:n:nolink}, but not the other way around.

Слово используется одним лицом мужского пола, адресуемое другому лицу(того же пола), являющемуся близким другом. Использование этого слова в других контекстах может быть сочтено оскорбительным или обидным. Слово может происходить от {may' qoch:n@@may':n, qoch:n}. Не является редким для Клингонского отца, который адресует подобное слово сыну {maqoch:n:nolink}, но не наоборот.
"My coach". See also {qoch:n}. Note that {maqoch:sen@@ma-:v, qoch:v} may be read as a sentence.

table.name: mem
table.column: This word can also mean "signal" in the sense of a sign that some action should be taken. This meaning comes from the opera {'u':src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: dark omen, sign of evil coming
علامت تاریک، نشانه ای از بد شدن [AUTOTRANSLATED]
illavarslade omen, tecken på förestående ondska, järtecken

table.name: mem
table.column: In order to succeed, we attack.
Wir greifen an um zu gewinnen.
برای موفقیت، ما حمله می کنیم. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
為了成功，我們進行攻擊。

table.name: mem
table.column: This little piggy went to market.

table.name: mem
table.column: Mara is Kang's wife (see {qeng:n:name}) and science officer, who appeared in the episode {TOS - Day of the Dove:src}.
Мара является женой Канга (смотрите {qeng:n:name}) и офицером по науке, которая появилась в эпизоде {TOS - Day of the Dove:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: Note that {marq:n:nolink} and {'oqranD:n:nolink} do not follow proper Klingon phonology, since they are part of an alien name.

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a movement of water.

table.name: mem
table.column: This little piggy went to the market.

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {jar DamaSqu'bogh yIngu'!:sen:nolink} "What is your favorite month?"[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This expression is used to describe the shape of the {betleH:n}.
Выражение использовано для того, чтобы описать форму {betleH:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: In the original Klingon version of {yulyuS qaySar:n:name} (Julius Caesar), the titular character is warned to beware the {maS'e' So'bogh pagh:n:nolink}. It is unclear why this was changed to the "ides" of March in the translation.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: Wir müssen ausbreiten, um zu überleben.
برای زنده ماندن، باید گسترش یابد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
För att överleva måste vi expandera. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
為了生存，我們必須擴大。

table.name: mem
table.column: Between us, curses run like water.
Beleidigungen laufen zwischen uns durch wie Wasser.
بین ما curses مانند آب اجرا می شود. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Mellan oss springar förbannelser som vatten. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Проклятия между нами бегут, как вода
在我們之間，咒語像水一樣流淌。

table.name: mem
table.column: Maltz is a prisoner of the Federation who lives in Marc Okrand's basement, and who is the source of much of the Federation's knowledge of the Klingon language.
Мальц это пленник от Федерации, который живёт в подвале Марка Окранда, и который является источником знаний Федерации о Клингонском языке.

table.name: mem
table.column: The word for liver is {chej:n} everywhere, but in some regions this word is used as an alternative.[1, p.28]
The regions where this word is used are not specified in {KGT:src}.[1, p.28]

table.name: mem
table.column: This word refers to a specific (concrete) battle, whereas {vIq:n} refers to battle or combat as a concept.

table.name: mem
table.column: to speak of another matter entirely
von einer komplett anderen Sache reden
به طور کلی از موضوع دیگری صحبت کردن [AUTOTRANSLATED]
att helt och hållet tala om en annan fråga [AUTOTRANSLATED]
The literal meaning of this idiomatic expression is "to sing a different battle song".
▶ {DaH may' bom pIm Dabom.:sen:nolink} "Well, that's another matter altogether."

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {beq may' ta vIlajpu'} "I have accepted the crew's record of battle"[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This was spoken by Worf (in Klingon) during his Rite of Ascension.
Это было сказано Ворфом, во время его ритуала посвящения.

table.name: mem
table.column: When a warrior goes to a battle, he does not abandon his friends.
Wenn ein Krieger in die Schlacht zieht, lässt er seine Freunde nicht alleine.
هنگامی که یک جنگجو به یک نبرد می رود، دوستانش را ترک نمی کند. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
När en krigare går till en kamp, ​​överger han inte sina vänner. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Когда воин идёт в битву, он не оставляет своих друзей
戰士去戰鬥時不會拋棄他的朋友。

table.name: mem
table.column: A Klingon does not run away from his battles.
Ein Klingone rennt nicht weg von seinen Schlachten.
کلینگان از جنگ هایش فرار نمی کند. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
En Klingon går inte bort från sina strider. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
克林崗人不會逃避他的戰鬥。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This sentence does not appear in canon. It is included here because it is used in some fan ceremonies.

table.name: mem
table.column: battle gear, panoply, complete set of armor and weapons
Rüstung (vollständige Kampfausrüstung, inkl. Waffen und Munition)
دنده نبرد، پانپللی، مجموعه کامل زره و سلاح [AUTOTRANSLATED]
stridsdon, full rustning, full uppsättning av rustning och vapen
戰鬥裝備、全副武裝、全套盔甲和武器 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a reference to Myron Floren, accordionist on "The Lawrence Welk Show".

table.name: mem
table.column: inhysa, ge husrum, betjäna, utrusta, förse
MO accommodated the filmmakers by changing {qama':sen@@qa-:v, ma':v} to mean "prisoner" while {Star Trek III:src} was being filmed. See {qama'pu' jonta' neH.:sen}

table.name: mem
table.column: A death ritual that allows one who has lost honor to die well and go to Sto-Vo-Kor by being honorably killed by a House-mate or someone equally close.

Смертельный ритуал, который позволяет тому, кто потерял честь, умереть достойно и почить в Стовокорре, будучи убитым. Ритуал проводит член дома, в котором состоит Клингон, или кто-то достаточно близкий.

This is written as {ma' to'vor:n:nolink} in the glossary to {Diplomatic Implausibility:src}, but the space appears to be a typo, as the word appears as {ma'to'vor:n:nolink} in the glossary to {A Good Day to Die:src}.
[1] {DS9 - Sons of Mogh:src}, [2] {Diplomatic Implausibility:src}, [3] {A Good Day to Die:src}

table.name: mem
table.column: ett slags ceremoniell kniv, mevak (används i Mauk-To'Vor-ritualen)
The "M'veQ" is a ceremonial knife used in the ritual of "Mauk To'Vor" ({ma'to'vor:n}).
М'Век это церемониальный нож, используемый для ритуала Мактовор ({ma'to'vor:n}).
This word's spelling was confirmed by MO. However, in the glossary to the non-canon {A Good Day to Die:src}, DeCandido writes this as {mevaq:n:nolink} "mevak dagger".
[1] {DS9 - Sons of Mogh:src}, [2] {KLI mailing list 1999.02.12:src}, [3] {KLI mailing list 2010.12.29:src}, [4] {paq'batlh p.184:src}

table.name: mem
table.column: Latin "mercari", from whence merchant, merchandise, etc.
▶ {nom yer mechmeH Quj} "The Fast-Dealing Property Trading Game"[2]
▶ {nom yer mechmeH Quj} "Торговая игра с быстрыми сделками"[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: end (of stick, rope, etc.), other end from {'er'In:n}
Ende (von Stab, Schnur, usw.), das gegenüberliegende Ende heißt {'er'In:n}
پایان (از چوب، طناب، و غیره)، پایان دیگری از {'er'In:n} [AUTOTRANSLATED]
結束（棍棒、繩索等）、另一端來自{'er'In：n} [AUTOTRANSLATED]

This can refer to either end of the rope, stick or whatever, but once you arbitrarily choose an end to call {megh'an:n:nolink}, the other end is called {'er'In:n:nolink}. Before you make this initial reference, either end can be called either {'er'In:n:nolink} or {megh'an:n:nolink}.
This is a private joke referring to a specific person.

table.name: mem
table.column: The word for the kind of bridge that goes over a river, or connects two locations, is {QI:n}.
Для слова мост(сооружение через реку), смотрите {QI:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: According to {KGT p.79:src}, there is no single word for "art" or "artwork". This refers to visual art (painting, sculpture, etc.). {meHghem:n:nolink} is a bigger, more comprehensive term covering "the arts" or "art" as opposed to "science". It includes music, theater, dance, etc., as well as visual art. It's "culture" in this sense.

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {tera' DIS cha' pagh wa' wej meHghem Qat Sub boq cherlu'.:sen:nolink} "In 2013, Popular Culture Hero Coalition was established."
[1] {Pop Culture Hero Coalition announcement:src} ({KLI mailing list 2016.11.30:src})

table.name: mem
table.column: lämna, avvika, ge sig av, avlägsna sig

In {TNK:src}, {DaH jImej:sen:nolink} is used for the Terran expression "goodbye".[2] This literally means "I'm leaving now". A Klingon, of course, would just leave, without superfluous niceties such as declaring his or her intention to do so.
To express leaving a person or object (rather than a location), consider {lon:v}.

В {TNK:src}, {DaH jImej:sen:nolink} используется для земного выражения "досвидания".[2] Дословно это значит "Я ухожу сейчас". Клингон конечно же просто уйдет, без лишних тонкостей, таких, как объявление о своем уходе.
Чтобы выразить уход от какого-то человека или объекта (скорее из какой-то локации), предпочитается слово {lon:v}.
▶ {bIghHa' DamejDI' pagh QaS yInob.:sen@@bIghHa':n, Da-:v, mej:v, -DI':v, pagh:n:2,num, QaS:n:1, yI-:v, nob:v} "Get out of jail free."[3]
▶ {bIghHa' DamejDI' pagh QaS yInob.:sen@@bIghHa':n, Da-:v, mej:v, -DI':v, pagh:n:2,num, QaS:n:1, yI-:v, nob:v} "Уходи из тюрьмы свободно."[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: This was shortened over time from {mejmeH 'aD:n@@mej:v, -meH:v, 'aD:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: A character in a famous Klingon opera.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is what a Klingon would call the Terran fruit.
Это то, что Клингон назовет земным фруктом

table.name: mem
table.column: reason, motive, logical thinking, topic, subject, theme
دلیل، انگیزه، تفکر منطقی، موضوع، موضوع، موضوع [AUTOTRANSLATED]
причина, мотив, логичное мышление, тема, субъект, предмет обсуждения
理性、動機、邏輯思維、主題、主題、主題 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This can be used to refer to the topic, subject, or theme of a conversation, story, etc. (That is, it describes the "reason" or "motive" for the conversation or story.)
Это может быть использовано, чтобы упомянуть о теме разговора, обсуждения, разговора и т.д.

This is defined as "reason" in {TKD:src} and as "motive" in the word lists in {KGT:src}. It is also glossed as "logical thinking" (in the sense of "motive") in the body of {KGT:src} on p.154. At {qep'a' 2018:src}, its definition was expanded to include "topic, subject, theme".
This was also used for the "logic" menu (instructions about program flow control) in Klingon Blockly.[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is defined only as "reason" in {TKD:src}. The definition was later expanded.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the portion of a trial or appeal where the evidence is heard.
Это часть разбирательства или аппеляции, когда заслушано доказательство

table.name: mem
table.column: The {meqleH:n:nolink} is also called the {meqleH matlh:n:nolink}, to differentiate it from the similar sounding {betleH:n}.
{meqleH:n:nolink} также называется {meqleH matlh:n:nolink}, чтобы отличить от {betleH:n}, который звучит похоже.

table.name: mem
table.column: In some dialects in this region, {letlh:n:2} refers only to the stairway connected to a ship, and {ngep'oS:n} refers to every other kind of stairway.
В некоторых диалектах в данном регионе, {letlh:n:2} относится только к лестнице, соединённой с кораблём, а {ngep'oS:n} от носится ко всем остальным видам лестниц.
This word appears only in the body of {KGT:src} on p.29 and not in the glossary. It appears as {meqro'vaq:n:nolink} and not as {meqro'vaq Sep:n:nolink}, but it is described as a region (see {Sep:n}).

table.name: mem
table.column: гореть, сжигать, обжечь, спалить, получить ожог

If there is no object, then the subject is the thing burning, e.g., {meQtaHbogh qachDaq Suv qoH neH.:sen}[2] If there is an object, then the subject is burning the object, e.g., {to'waQ meQ vutwI'.}[3] {meQ:v:nolink} can also be used adjectivally, e.g., {Ha'DIbaHmey meQ Sop 'e' tIv tera'nganpu'@@Ha'DIbaH:n:1, -mey:n, meQ:v, Sop:v, 'e':n, tIv:v, tera'ngan:n, -pu':n}.[4]

Если нет объекта, тогда субъект это вещь, которая горит, например {meQtaHbogh qachDaq Suv qoH neH.:sen}[2] Если есть объект, тогда субъект сжигает объект, например., {to'waQ meQ vutwI'.}[3] {meQ:v:nolink} может также использоваться для прикладных вещей, например, {Ha'DIbaHmey meQ Sop 'e' tIv tera'nganpu'@@Ha'DIbaH:n:1, -mey:n, meQ:v, Sop:v, 'e':n, tIv:v, tera'ngan:n, -pu':n}.[4]
In the sentence from {CK:src}, {tIv:sen:nolink} should have been {lutIv:sen:nolink} since {tera'nganpu':n:nolink} is plural.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is "the banner of unity and revolution" used by {qeylIS'e' lIjlaHbe'bogh vay':n:name} to rally his troops.
Это "флаг единства и революции" использовался {qeylIS'e' lIjlaHbe'bogh vay':n:name} чтобы сплотить его войска.

table.name: mem
table.column: Only a fool fights in a burning house.
Nur ein Narr kämpft in einem brennenden Haus.
فقط یک احمقانه در یک خانه سوزان می جنگد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Bara en dåre slåss i ett brinnande hus. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Только глупец сражается в горящем доме
只有傻瓜在燃燒的房屋裡打架。

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {jImeS.:sen:nolink} "I make a knot." ▶ {tlhegh vImeS.:sen:nolink} "I make a knot in the rope."

table.name: mem
table.column: As with {So'Ha':v:nolink}, this implies that the person doing the decryption knows what he or she is doing ahead of time and is not cracking a code.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is an instrument which consists of interlocking tubes.
A "noisy mess". Note that the words {meS:v:1h} and {meS:n} did not exist when this word was published.

table.name: mem
table.column: When used as a command, this word means to stop doing something. It would not be used for stopping a device (such as an engine).[2]
Когда используется в качестве команды, это слово значит прекратить что-либо делать. Это слово не используется чтобы приказать что-либо выключить.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: stopp, det är bra, det är nog

table.name: mem
table.column: This is what Klingons would call Terran sweet corn (maize).

table.name: mem
table.column:
This is technically a {letbaQ HoS:n@@letbaQ:n, HoS:v}.
This word can also refer to the "diamond" suit in a deck of playing cards (see {Degh:n:1}).[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: A n-sided polygon is an {n reD mey':n:nolink} for n > 3. For example: {loS reD mey':n}, {vagh reD mey':n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: The child of a {me':n:nolink} is a {tey':n:1}.
This is a reference to Aunt "Em" from The Wizard of Oz.

table.name: mem
table.column: 阿姨（母親的兄弟的妻子） [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: быть злым, быть порочным, быть зловещим

table.name: mem
table.column: vara fordom ärad, vara tidigare hedrad

Loss of honor is implied by this verb, which is used as an adjective to describe one who has fallen from grace. It is not applicable to someone who would be described as {'utlh:n}, a word which implies a voluntary, honorable retirement.
This is a reference to Richard "Mil"house Nixon.

table.name: mem
table.column: This word can be used for any sort of depiction, including drawings, photographs, cartoons, icons on 21st-century computers, and so on.
This is a combination of the Latin word for "thousand" with the Greek word for "word".

table.name: mem
table.column: Do not delay. Alter your course now.
Zögere nicht. Ändere jetzt deinen Kurs.
تاخیر نکنید. اکنون درس خود را تغییر دهید [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Försena inte. Ändra din kurs nu. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
不要拖延。立即改變你的課程。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This line was cut from {Star Trek V:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: Note that this word is singular, unlike the English word "sunglasses".

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the most common way to refer to a person who performs magic. For a true wizard or sorcerer, see {'IDnar pIn'a':n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a reference to McDonald's, which is known as "Mickey D's".

table.name: mem
table.column: A Klingon forehead looks like it's deep-fried.

table.name: mem
table.column: This can also be used metaphorically or symbolically (see {mIr:n:2}).
Это может быть использовано, как метафора(см. {mIr:n:2}).

table.name: mem
table.column: "Meerschaum", also known as sepiolite, is a material from which some smoking pipes are made.

table.name: mem
table.column:
"Mish" mash.
This was clarified to mean "mental confusion" at {qep'a' 2017:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: Shakespeare's play {paghmo' tIn mIS:sen:nolink}, literally "The Confusion is Great Because of Nothing", has been translated into English as "Much Ado About Nothing" by the {tlhIngan Hol yejHaD:n}.
Шекспировская пьеса {paghmo' tIn mIS:sen:nolink}, дословно "Велико смущение из ничего", было переведено, как "Много шума из ничего" {tlhIngan Hol yejHaD:n}.

"Mish" mash.
This was clarified to mean "mental confusion" at {qep'a' 2017:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This was clarified to mean "mental confusion" at {qep'a' 2017:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the name of the sculptor who made Blood Oath Circles ({'Iw 'Ip ghomey:n}).
Это имя скульптора, который создал круги кровной клятвы ({'Iw 'Ip ghomey:n}).
The English spelling of this name was never given in {KCD:src}. The spelling is therefore uncertain.

table.name: mem
table.column: be appropriate, be suitable, be proper for the situation
مناسب باشد، مناسب باشد، برای وضعیت مناسب باشد [AUTOTRANSLATED]
vara lämplig, vara lämplig, vara lämplig för situationen [AUTOTRANSLATED]
"Meet" (archaic English adjective meaning suitable or proper).

table.name: mem
table.column:
In {TNK:src}, {mIv:n:1,nolink} is used for "hat".
See {mIvDaq pogh cha':sen} for an idiom involving {mIv:n:nolink}.

В {TNK:src}, {mIv:n:1,nolink} используется, как "шляпа".
Смотрите {mIvDaq pogh cha':sen} для идиомы, где используется слово {mIv:n:nolink}.

table.name: mem
table.column: a matter has been postponed or rescheduled
یک موضوع به تعویق افتاده یا تغییر یافته است [AUTOTRANSLATED]
en fråga har skjutits upp eller omplacerats [AUTOTRANSLATED]
一件事已被推遲或重新安排 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

This expression literally means "to display a glove on one's helmet", and is used to convey the idea that a matter has been postponed or rescheduled. The phrase takes a number of forms, as appropriate to the parties to the commitment. For example, {mIvwIjDaq poghlIj vIcha':sen:nolink} "I display your glove on my helmet" implies that the postponed matter is between the speaker and the addressee.
This idiom has its origin in {HenrI' vagh:n:name}, a play by {wIlyam SeQpIr:n:name}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a {bargh:n} made of metal.

table.name: mem
table.column: fully dressed (as for a ceremonial affair)
به طور کامل لباس (به عنوان یک روابط تشریفاتی) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
helt klädd (som för en ceremoniell affär) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Note that this idiom does not follow proper grammar, in that normally {je:conj} would be at the end.
▶ {mIv je DaS tuQ ra'wI'.:sen:nolink} "The commander is in full dress uniform."

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a ceremonial headpiece worn by some emperors.

table.name: mem
table.column:
This is a scar which is the result of a wound (regardless of how the wound occurred).[1]
A tally or score is kept by counting {mIvwa'mey:n@@mIvwa':n, -mey:n}. This is also used for "census" or "headcount".[2]

Dies ist eine Narbe als Folge einer Verletzung (egal wie diese entstanden ist).[1]
A tally or score is kept by counting {mIvwa'mey:n@@mIvwa':n, -mey:n}. This is also used for "census" or "headcount".[2]
This was defined as just "scar", with an accompanying explanation of the kinds of scars.

table.name: mem
table.column: procedure, process, step, stage (in a process)
Prozedur, Prozess, Ablauf; Schritt, Stadium (in einem Ablauf)
روش، فرآیند، مرحله، مرحله (در یک روند) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
程序、過程、步驟、階段（在一個過程中） [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This was used to refer to a concept in computer programming, namely, a compartmentalized piece of computer code which has inputs and outputs and is used over and over, in Klingon Blockly.[3]

table.name: mem
table.column:
Number-forming elements include {maH:n:2,num}, {vatlh:n:num}, {SaD:n:num} ({SanID:n:num}), {netlh:n:num}, {bIp:n:num}, {'uy':n:num}.
When a number is used for numbering (labeling), as opposed to counting, it follows the noun. Ordinal numbers are formed with {-DIch:n:num,suff}. Repetitions are formed with {-logh:n:num,suff}.

Элементы для формирования чисел, включают {maH:n:2,num}, {vatlh:n:num}, {SaD:n:num} ({SanID:n:num}), {netlh:n:num}, {bIp:n:num}, {'uy':n:num}.
Когда число используется для нумерации чего-то, в отличие от счёта, оно следует за существительным. Порядковые номера сформированы с {-DIch:n:num,suff}. Повторы сформированы с помощью {-logh:n:num,suff}.
▶ {ghogh HablI' mI' yIper:sen:nolink} "What is the telephone number?"[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: In {Klingon Monopoly:src}, {mI' naghmey:n:nolink} refers to the playing dice. The verb {ron:v} is used for the action of throwing or rolling the dice.

▶ {pIraqSIS HoS waw' ghajlu'chugh, loSlogh boq'egh mI' naghmey mI'; chen qav'ap.:sen:nolink} "If Praxis Energy Facility is owned, rent is 4 times amount shown on dice." ▶ {HoSHal ghajchugh vay', mI' naghmey tIronmoH. wa'maHlogh boq'egh mI' naghmey; chen qav'ap. ghajwI'vaD qav'ap yIDIl.:sen:nolink} "If [energy source is] owned, throw dice and pay owner a total ten times amount shown."

table.name: mem
table.column: This was used in Klingon Blockly. The usage was vetted by Marc Okrand.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: dance, run in place, do calisthenics
رقص، اجرا در محل، انجام کلامی [AUTOTRANSLATED]
dansa, springa på stället, göra gymnastik, träna

table.name: mem
table.column: This can be used to translate "cabaret" if the cabaret show consists entirely or nearly entirely of dancing, but that's a special and infrequent situation.

table.name: mem
table.column: Jacob Bernouilli refered to the logarithmic spiral as "spira mirabilis".

table.name: mem
table.column: عجیب و غریب (استفاده می شود در ریاضیات) [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This may be a reference to "Depeche Mode". "Dépêcher" means to "to hurry" in French. However, {Qov:n:name} asked MO about this and he answered he didn't remember if it was deliberate.
▶ {moD Soj:sen:nolink} "the food hurries" (sign in a {Do Qe':n})[2]

table.name: mem
mem
table.column:
This word may also be written {mojaQ:n:nolink}.
There are five types of noun suffixes and nine types of verb suffixes in Klingon, for which see {DIp:n} and {wot:n}, respectively.

Это слово также может быть записано, как {mojaQ:n:nolink}.
Есть 5 типов суффиксов существительных и 9 типов глагольных суффиксов в Клингонском языке, для которых смотрите {DIp:n} и {wot:n}, соответственно.

table.name: mem
mem
table.column: This might be used for a bone or a fossil.

table.name: mem
table.column:
This is the evil tyrant ({HI''a':n}) defeated by {qeylIS'e' lIjlaHbe'bogh vay':n:name}, as recounted in the {paq'batlh:n}.
There is an idiom, {mIgh; molor rur}.

Это злой тиран ({HI''a':n}) побежденный {qeylIS'e' lIjlaHbe'bogh vay':n:name}, как рассказано в {paq'batlh:n}.
Есть идиома, {mIgh; molor rur}.

table.name: mem
table.column: لبخند، لبخند زدن، عصبانیت، عصبانیت، عصبانیت [AUTOTRANSLATED]
微笑、咧嘴笑、冷笑、咆哮、傻笑 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

A reference to the Mona Lisa. {mon'a':sen:nolink} means "Is she smiling?"
This word is defined in {KGT:src} as "smile, grin, sneer".[1] It is explained that it can also mean "snarl" and "smirk" in a message on the msn newsgroup.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: A parry where you thrust a sword or other edged weapon behind your neck in order to block an attack from the rear.

table.name: mem
table.column: ضرب و شتم (چیزی با پیاده سازی) [AUTOTRANSLATED]

This is used to signal the start of a duel.[1, p.68]
It is also used for beating {'In:n} (compare to {tlhaw':v} and {weq:v}).[1, p.75]
Note that the verb used for a heartbeat is {joq:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a bruise you can see, but which is not an open wound.

table.name: mem
table.column: This word is also used to refer to the spiked pommel at end of a {Daqtagh:n}.
Это слово также используется, чтобы упомяуть о шипованной головке на конце {Daqtagh:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: Depending on context, one can also say {Soy'Ha':v@@Soy':v:1, -Ha':v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the brother of {qeylIS'e' lIjlaHbe'bogh vay':n:name}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This means being rendered unconscious or into a dazed state as a result of being hit (by a fist or a projectile, etc.). This would be used for being hit by a phaser "set to stun".
Dies bedeutet, nach einem Schlag oder einem Treffer bewusstlos bzw. kampfunfähig geworden zu sein. Dies würde man sagen, wenn man von einem Phaser getroffen wurde, der auf "betäuben" gestellt war.

table.name: mem
table.column: be usual, be standard, be normal
به طور معمول، استاندارد باشد، طبیعی باشد [AUTOTRANSLATED]
vara vanlig, vara normal, vara standard
быть обычным, быть стандартным, быть нормальным

In {TKD:src}, this is defined only as "be usual".[1] In {SkyBox 14:src}, {nISwI' HIch motlh:n:nolink} is translated as "standard hand held disruptor".[2] In the {BoP:src} poster, {qughDo motlh:n:nolink} is translated as "normal cruising speed".[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: معمولا معمولا به عنوان انتظار می رود [AUTOTRANSLATED]
vanligtvis, som vanligt, som väntat, normal sett

table.name: mem
table.column: غیر معمول، غیر معمول، نه به عنوان انتظار می رود [AUTOTRANSLATED]
出奇、異常、非典型、不如預期
This word does not appear in canon. This entry is here for ease of reference only.

table.name: mem
table.column: "Today was a good day to die."
"Heute war ein guter Tag zum Sterben."
"Idag var en bra dag att dö." [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This exclamation is archaic. It was spoken by Kahless to Lukara. The modern equivalent is {Heghlu'meH QaQ jajvam.:sen}
today was a good day to die

table.name: mem
table.column: slunga, slungmanöver, gravitationsslunga (runt himlakropp med rymdskepp)

table.name: mem
table.column: 動機、動機、理由、理由、理由 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
The meaning and use of this slang word are explained on {KGT p.154:src}.
▶ {jaghpu' mo' wIyajnIS.} "We must understand the enemies' motive."[1, p.154]

table.name: mem
table.column: Outside of a musical context, this word can also mean to "present a gift" to someone.
Вне музыкального контекста, это слово может также означать "презентовать подарок" кому-то.
This word was defined in {TKD:src} as "present". The definition "perform (music)" was added in {KGT:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This can be used for something like a show or a movie.[2] However, it isn't quite right for expressing "media" in general.[3]
Это может быть использовано для чего-то наподобие шоу или кино.[2] Тем не менее, не совсем корректно для обозначения "медиа" в общем.[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the room in which a performance takes place.
Maltz revealed this word to translate "Bloomsbury Theatre" for the {Festival of the Spoken Nerd DVD:src}, but it ended up not being used on the DVD itself.

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the whole building, including the auditorium, lobby, dressing rooms, and so on.
Maltz revealed this word to translate "Bloomsbury Theatre" for the {Festival of the Spoken Nerd DVD:src}, but it ended up not being used on the DVD itself.

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the location, such as a nightclub or restaurant, where there's food/drink along with a show ({Qe' much:n}).

table.name: mem
table.column: The word for weather, meaning the state of the atmosphere, is the same word as for the atmosphere itself (see {muD:n:2}).[2]
Слово для погоды, означающее состояние атмосферы, это тоже самое слово, как и для атмосферы (смотрите {muD:n:2}).[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: The word for weather, meaning the state of the atmosphere, is the same word as for the atmosphere itself (see {muD:n:1}). When inquiring about weather conditions at a specific time and/or place, the expression {muD Dotlh:n} is used.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: The Klingon word for "weather" in the sense of the state of the atmosphere is just {muD:n:2}, the same word as for the atmosphere itself ({muD:n:1}). The expression {muD Dotlh:n:nolink} is used when inquiring about weather conditions at a specific time and/or place.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This word is plural. Its singular form is unknown.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is similar to {magh:v}, and as the proverb goes, "a translator is a traitor".

table.name: mem
table.column: One of the more notable native animal forms on {nural:n}.
Одна из наиболее заметных животных форм на {nural:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This implies translation, and isn't used for closed captions.
This was actually given in the plural {mughbogh permey:n:nolink} as "subtitles".

table.name: mem
table.column: If this refers to a person, its plural takes the {-pu':n:suff} suffix. If it refers to a device, its plural takes the {-mey:n:suff} suffix.
Если это относится к человеку, то, его форма во множественном числе принимает {-pu':n:suff} суффикс. Если это относится к устройству, то форма во множественном числе принимает {-mey:n:suff} суффикс.

table.name: mem
table.column: быть неверным, быть некорректным, быть неправильным
Note that this means "be incorrect, factually wrong", as opposed to {waS:v} "be amiss, awry".
Заметьте, что это значит "быть неверным, фактически неправильным", в отличии от {waS:v} "что-то не так, идти наперекосяк".
This is missing from the E-K side of {TKD:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: Do not confuse this with {waH:v:2}, which means "taste" in the sense of trying out food to see if it's been properly prepared or to determine if one likes it.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: People who joined the "Moon"ies were often subjected to a deprogramming process known as intervention.

table.name: mem
mem
table.column: There is an idiom, {HoSghaj; mupwI' rur}.

table.name: mem
table.column: hassen, verabscheuen, starke Abneigung haben, Animositäten hegen

table.name: mem
mem
table.column: I need a target that fights back.
Ich brauche ein Ziel, das zurückschießt.
من به یک هدف نیاز دارم که به مبارزه می پردازد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Jag behöver ett mål som kämpar tillbaka. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
我需要一個反擊的目標。

table.name: mem
table.column: ساخت، جمع آوری، جمع آوری، ساخت [AUTOTRANSLATED]

A {mutlhwI':n:nolink} is a person who puts things together.
A person who repairs things is a {tI'wI':n}. Most {mutlhwI'pu':n:nolink} are also {tI'wI'pu':n:nolink}.
When applied to {tlhIm:n}, {mutlh:v:nolink} means to assemble the carpet. The verb for laying a carpet is {vel:v}.

The original definition given on the {KLI mailing list:src} was "construct, assemble, put together". This word was also defined as "manufacture, construct, put together" in the {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2016:src} booklet.
▶ {ngogh mutlhwI':n} "bricklayer" ▶ {majyang mutlhwI':n} "tiler" ▶ {beb mutlhwI':n} "roofer" ▶ {'och mutlhwI':n} "plumber" ▶ {'ul pat mutlhwI':n} "electrician"

table.name: mem
table.column: The subject does the uniting, while the objects are united.
▶ {Qo'noS tuqmey muvchuqmoH qeylIS:sen:nolink} "Kahless united the tribes of Kronos"[1, p.179]

table.name: mem
table.column: See {qawmoH:v} for an example of how to use a verb like this one.
Siehe {qawmoH:v} für Beispiele, wie man dieses Verb verwenden kann.
Смотрите {qawmoH:v} для примера того, как использовать глагол, подобный этому.

table.name: mem
table.column: trötta ord (används om äldre klingoners språk)
This is how vocabulary used by older Klingons in everyday speech is referred to by younger Klingons.

table.name: mem
table.column: slang, "färska ord" (används mest av yngre klingoner)
This refers to the vocabulary used by younger Klingons.
This is defined only as "slang" in the {KGT:src} word lists, and erroneously written as {mu'mey qhoQ:n:nolink} in the K-E side. It is glossed as "fresh words" in the body text.

table.name: mem
table.column: Those who dislike slang refer to standard words using this expression.

table.name: mem
table.column: tillfälliga ord (ogrammatiskt uttryck använt för effekt)
This refers to words or phrases coined for a specific occasion, and which intentionally violate grammatical rules for impact.

table.name: mem
table.column: curse warfare, a kind of sport
